description: Extensions are being used to implement core functionality, e.g. SSH key management.  But there are no XML schema files for them, which makes them difficult to use from strongly-typed languages.
title: No schema for extensions?

comments.content: Extensions are being used to implement core functionality, e.g. SSH key management.  But there are no XML schema files for them, which makes them difficult to use from strongly-typed languages.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
I believe so (see below), although there's no reason that an extension couldn't formally document its schema somewhere (that I know of).  From my point of view as an API consumer, including the schema in the nova source (as is the case with the openstack API) would be great.

~/github/nova$ find . -name "*.rng"
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/atom.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/images_index.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/flavor.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/flavors_index.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/extensions.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/flavors.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/limits.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/images.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/extension.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/addresses.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/server.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/servers.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/image.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/metadata.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/version.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/servers_index.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/v1.1/versions.rng
./nova/api/openstack/schemas/atom-link.rng
~/github/nova$ find . -name "*.xsd"
(no results)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
I am planing these API schema documents will be created from API schemas which are used for API validation.
That task is related to blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-api-validation-fw
I guess that task will start after the implementation of Nova v3 api completes.

comments.content:
